triples.evidence: We know that X-rays can penetrate deeply into tissue, and we also know that nanophosphors can convert X-rays into visible light.
The nanophosphors there absorb the X-rays and emit light locally - right where the neurons are.

We know that X-rays can penetrate deeply into tissue, and we also know that nanophosphors can convert X-rays into visible light. So, what if we could use X-rays as a remote light source to activate optogenetic proteins deep inside the brain?
